alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Grafton County through 130 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Piermont to near Quechee. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Lincoln, Hanover, Haverhill, Enfield, Canaan, Franconia, Woodstock, Piermont, Lyme, Bath, Benton, Dorchester, Easton, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Warren, Orford, Landaff and Rumney. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 54 and 60. Interstate 93 between mile markers 98 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
